info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 27 at 11:08PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Mitchell, Scurry, southeastern Borden and northeastern Howard Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1107 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near J B Thomas Reservoir, or 12 miles southwest of Snyder, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Snyder, Inadale, J B Thomas Reservoir, Dunn, Hermleigh, Randalls Corner, Winston Field, Ira, Cuthbert and Knapp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for western Texas.
